content: Electric power can be delivered over long distances by transmission lines and used for applications such as motion, light or heat. More than 100 years ago, houses were lit with kerosene lamps, food was chilled in iceboxes, and rooms were warmed by wood-burning or coal-burning stoves. It all started with Benjamin Franklin's experiment with a kite one stormy night in Philadelphia, and then the idea of electricity slowly became implicit. In the mid-1800s, a life changing invention saw the light of day; The electric light bulb. In the year 1879, electricity had been used in arc lights for outdoor lighting. With the light bulbâ€™s electrical light was brought to our homes.

Along with electricity many useful tools that has changed the world into what it is today emerged. The radio is one of them. The radio brought entertainment and news broadcasts into the private homes. The first practical radio transmitters and receivers were developed around 1895-6 by Italian Guglielmo Marconi, and radio began to be used commercially around 1900. Radio waves are also used for mobile phones, television braodcasts and WiFi.
